setup-1.title: Configuration and Imports
setup-1.finding: Color scheme and figure styling configured for publication-quality output

exec-1.title: Bias Magnitude Overview
exec-1.finding: Bias ranges from +118% (BMI underestimate) to -2137% (CHD overestimate)

exec-2.title: Sign-Flip Demonstration
exec-2.finding: Rowen CHD score flips from +0.0369 to -0.7509 (protective to risk)

valid-1.title: Load Comparison Data
valid-1.finding: pgsc_calc and custom script scores loaded for comparison

valid-3.title: Validation Scatter Plot
valid-3.finding: All points fall on identity line, confirming mathematical equivalence

bias-1.title: Variant Source Breakdown
bias-1.finding: 47-52% of scoring variants are NOT in the VCF (require reference lookup)

bias-3.title: Bias Heatmap
bias-3.finding: Bias patterns are consistent across samples for each PGS score

direction-1.title: BMI Case Study (Underestimate)
direction-1.finding: BMI shows +118% underestimate due to effect allele distribution in REF-lookup variants

direction-2.title: CHD Case Study (Overestimate)
direction-2.finding: CHD shows -2137% overestimate with complete sign reversal

direction-3.title: Variant Source Visualization
direction-3.finding: ~50% of variants come from reference lookup but bias direction varies by score

ancestry-1.title: Z-Scores and Percentiles
ancestry-1.finding: Ancestry-normalized scores appear reasonable but mask underlying bias

ancestry-2.title: Mathematical Demonstration
ancestry-2.finding: Z-scores cancel uniform bias but don't fix individual-level variation or sign flips

trent-mid-ancestry.title: Trent MID Ancestry Analysis
trent-mid-ancestry.finding: 10D PCA shows Trent closer to EUR (21 units) than MID (41 units), but 32% MID reflects genuine admixture from Druze/Palestinian/Bedouin populations

variant-1.title: Variant Count vs Bias
variant-1.finding: No correlation between variant count and bias magnitude

variant-2.title: Variant Source Breakdown
variant-2.finding: All scores have similar ref-lookup rates (~47-52%)

variant-3.title: Weight Sum Analysis
variant-3.finding: effect_ref_lookup weight sum × 2 = exact bias amount

variant-4.title: Weight Sum Visualization
variant-4.finding: Weight direction determines bias direction (positive→underestimate, negative→overestimate)

variant-6.title: Construction Method Comparison
variant-6.finding: Score construction method (PRS-CSx vs LDpred) doesn't predict bias

variant-7.title: Ref Lookup Rate Comparison
variant-7.finding: Ref lookup rates are similar (~50%) across all scores

variant-8.title: Recommendations
variant-8.finding: Use PGS004237 (CAD) over PGS004696 (CHD) for WGS reliability

clinical-1.title: Risk Stratification Example
clinical-1.finding: Rowen CHD: VCF-only suggests protective, adjusted shows elevated risk

clinical-2.title: Clinical Summary Table
clinical-2.finding: 2 scores show sign reversal, 4 show >50% bias, only 4 show minimal bias

rowen-ancestry-1.title: Load Rowen Ancestry Data (HGDP+1000G)
rowen-ancestry-1.finding: Rowen classified as MID (41%), EUR (37%) with Low Confidence using HGDP+1000G panel (previous 1000G-only showed EUR 75%)

rowen-ancestry-2.title: Ancestry Composition Comparison (Same Reference)
rowen-ancestry-2.finding: Both show substantial MID ancestry: Rowen MID 41%/EUR 37%, Trent EUR 45%/MID 32% - both Low Confidence due to admixture

rowen-ancestry-3.title: PCA Projection Comparison
rowen-ancestry-3.finding: Both samples show EUR-MID admixture pattern; reference panel choice revealed hidden MID ancestry

rowen-ancestry-4.title: Ancestry-Normalized Percentiles
rowen-ancestry-4.finding: Percentiles normalized within EUR but still affected by VCF bias in reference panel
